articles.description: Paul Pogba's career could be over after his four-year ban for doping with the feeling the 30-year-old Juventus player never fulfilled his potential.
articles.title: The end for Pogba and what should have been?

articles.description: Marcus Rashford wants critics to show "more humanity" before doubting his commitment to boyhood club Manchester United.
articles.title: Don't question my commitment to Man Utd - Rashford

articles.description: Red Bull team principal Christian Horner denies allegations of inappropriate behaviour again after a series of alleged messages are leaked.
articles.title: Christian Horner: Red Bull team principal denies claims again after alleged messages leak

articles.description: Athletic Bilbao comfortably beat Atletico Madrid to set up a Copa del Rey final against Mallorca on 6 April.
articles.title: Athletic Bilbao beat Atletico to reach Copa del Rey final

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton leads a Mercedes one-two in Friday practice at the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix.
articles.title: Lewis Hamilton tops Bahrain Grand Prix second practice

articles.description: Emma Raducanu is set for a return to WTA Tour action next month at one of the biggest tournaments outside of the Grand Slams.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu given Miami Open wildcard

articles.description: Wing Elliot Daly says England's plan to attack Ireland in the Six Nations is the "clearest" it has been in years.
articles.title: England 'clear' on how to attack Ireland - Daly

articles.description: World Athletics president Lord Coe calls the proposed Enhanced Games, where doping is allowed, nonsense.
articles.title: Enhanced Games: Lord Coe says athletes would be 'moronic' to take part in event where doping allowed

articles.description: Al-Nassr forward Cristiano Ronaldo is banned for one match for "provoking fans" following the Saudi Pro League win over Al-Shabab.
articles.title: Ronaldo banned for gesture after 'Messi' chants

articles.description: Fulham "should apologise" for posting a video on TikTok that appears to mock Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes, says Erik ten Hag.
articles.title: 'Fulham should apologise for Fernandes TikTok'
